original_title: Sri Lanka rupee closes at Rs307/310 to US dollar, bond yields up
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s rupee closed at 307.00/310.00 to the US dollar amid interventions and moral suasion Thursday dealers said, while yields were also up on currency jitters.
The Spot US dollar closed at 310.00/315.00 rupees on Wednesday.
Interventions were seen in the market around 314 to the US dollar.
The central bank injected 25.5 billion rupees overnight in to the market at 13.47 percent.
A bond maturing on 15.09.2027 closed at 23.00/20 percent, up from 22.70/22.90 percent a day earlier.
A bond maturing on 15.05.2026 closed at 24.75/25.25 percent, up from 23.80/24.10 percent.
A bond maturing on 01.05.2025 closed at 27.00/75 percent. up from 25.90/26.20 percent. (Colombo/June15/2023)
